column4: Trying to get my mic to work - found some forum posts re: alsamixer, but not seeing how to ensure that a capture source is turned on for capture
In alsa mixer, I have three capture sources - docking mic, External mic, and internal mic.
I have all turned up to 100, but still no dice with Sound Recorder or Skype
its a huge pain in the ass, because it seems like each computer gets slightly different options
and random things get set to mute at random
- pointers of where to start? Jaunty on an HP laptop, with NVidia audio.
first, open up both Sound Preferences and Volume Control
now, in volume control, go to preferences and set all tracks to be visible
this should result in a bunch of tabs being open
now, on the playback tab, set master volume to whatever you want, set PCM to 100%, and set ALL the other mics, boosts, and beeps to mute or 0 volume
- I only have Master channel in Vol Ctrl prefs
that sucks, and is exactly what im talking about
- wait - under Device, if I change it, I get more playback options
this needs a minute or 2 to finish uploadting, but it shows my working settings on a thinkpad t61... http://files.getdropbox.com/u/234638/screencast.ogv
